indications.text: rufinamide oral suspension indicated adjunctive treatment seizures associated lennox-gastaut syndrome pediatric patients 1 year age older adults .

contraindications.text: rufinamide oral suspension given food . ( 2.2 ) measure oral suspension using provided adapter dosing syringe ( 2.2 ) pediatric patients 1 year older : starting daily dose : 10 mg/kg per day two equally divided doses ( 2.1 ) increase 10 mg/kg increments every day maximum dose 45 mg/kg per day , exceed 3,200 mg per day , two divided doses ( 2.1 ) adults : starting daily dose : 400 800 mg per day two equally divided doses ( 2.1 ) increase 400 800 mg every day maximum dose 3,200 mg per day , two divided doses , reached ( 2.1 )

adverseReactions: rufinamide contraindicated patients familial short qt syndrome [ ( 5.3 ) ] .
name: Rufinamide
indications_original: Rufinamide oral suspension is indicated for adjunctive treatment of seizures associated with Lennox-Gastaut Syndrome in pediatric patients 1 year of age and older and in adults.
contraindications_original: Rufinamide oral suspension should be given with food. ( 2.2 ) Measure oral suspension using provided adapter and dosing syringe ( 2.2 ) Pediatric patients 1 year and older: Starting daily dose: 10 mg/kg per day in two equally divided doses ( 2.1 ) Increase by 10 mg/kg increments every other day to maximum dose of 45 mg/kg per day, not to exceed 3,200 mg per day, in two divided doses ( 2.1 ) Adults: Starting daily dose: 400 to 800 mg per day in two equally divided doses ( 2.1 ) Increase by 400 to 800 mg every other day until a maximum dose of 3,200 mg per day, in two divided doses, is reached ( 2.1 )
adverseReactions_original: Rufinamide is contraindicated in patients with Familial Short QT syndrome [see Warnings and Precautions (5.3)].
